summary: This is a deposition transcript of Ghislaine Maxwell from April 9, 2019, taken in a slip and fall lawsuit in New York. The document was forwarded in 2020 by attorneys at Boies Schiller Flexner LLP. In the deposition, Maxwell answers questions about her residences, citizenship, business entities (Ellmax LLC and Terramar Project), employment, and financial arrangements.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The individual being deposed in a slip and fall case. She answers questions about her personal life, businesses, and residences.

persons.name: Sigrid McCawley
persons.role: Partner at Boies Schiller Flexner LLP
persons.context: The attorney who forwarded the deposition transcript via email on March 23, 2020.

persons.name: Sandra Perkins
persons.role: Case Manager at Boies Schiller Flexner LLP
persons.context: The individual who initially sent the deposition transcript and summary to Sigrid McCawley.

persons.name: Matthew Cuomo
persons.context: Listed as the attorney for the defendant from the law firm Cuomo, LLC, on the deposition header.

persons.name: Sheldon Barr
persons.context: Named as a plaintiff in the slip and fall lawsuit.

persons.name: Thomas Gardner
persons.context: Named as a plaintiff in the slip and fall lawsuit.

persons.name: Darren Indyke
persons.context: A lawyer who helped Ghislaine Maxwell create the company Ellmax LLC.

persons.name: Robert Foos
persons.context: Identified by Maxwell as a contracted employee for the Terramar Project, Inc.

persons.name: Monte Albers De Leon
persons.context: A lawyer Maxwell used, who attended the closing for the sale of a property on her behalf.

connections.description: Darren Indyke, a lawyer, helped Maxwell create her company Ellmax LLC.
Maxwell states Robert Foos was a contracted employee (Director of Development) for the Terramar Project.
Maxwell used Monte Albers De Leon as a lawyer, authorizing him to attend a property closing for her.
Colleagues at Boies Schiller Flexner LLP; Perkins sent the deposition transcript to McCawley.

events.title: Ghislaine Maxwell Deposition
events.description: Examination before trial of Ghislaine Maxwell in a New York slip and fall lawsuit (Sheldon Barr and Thomas Gardner v. City of New York and Ghislaine Maxwell).

events.title: Email Forwarding Deposition
events.description: Sigrid McCawley forwards Ghislaine Maxwell's 2019 deposition transcript to an unnamed recipient, noting her paralegal found it.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell testified in April 2019 that she is a U.S. citizen (since the mid-1990s) and also a citizen of France and England.
Maxwell stated she ran a company called Ellmax LLC, which she used to advise businesses and cover travel costs, and that lawyer Darren Indyke helped create it.
She claimed to have worked 60 hours a week for the Terramar Project, a not-for-profit entity, but said she and other board members received no compensation.
Maxwell testified she had a personal assistant for over ten years (starting around 2001-2002) whom she paid personally, not through Ellmax.
The deposition was taken in a civil slip and fall case, and the document's forwarding in 2020 suggests legal teams were circulating it for potential relevance to other matters.
